title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

author: George Orwell
description: A story about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance to control its citizens.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment that comes with it.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A story about the quest for revenge against the white whale Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that intertwines the lives of several characters during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about a teenager's disillusionment and search for identity.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins to help a group of dwarves reclaim their home.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A story about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A novel about a shepherd's journey to discover his personal legend.
